alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 11 at 10:07AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1206 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 1206 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1007 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Bernardino, Fontana, Rialto, Redlands, Yucaipa, Highland, Colton, Loma Linda and Running Springs. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
